author: sproul
content:
Hey <@453386940490711054> <@144468805697929216>, regarding CLWP, would it be sufficient for clients to support a pre-loaded list of `SignedBlsToExecutionChange`s? This would be a lot simpler for us to implement as all our code already deals with and understands `SignedBlsToExecutionChange`s. The file formats defined currently in EIP-4736 are more bespoke and would be less clean for us to implement (referring to the formats defined here: <https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-4736#1-change-withdrawal-address-acceptance-file>).

On the CLWP side, I think it would just require users to submit their `SignedBlsToExecutionChange` to the CLWP Github repo. The messages could be checked against the Kleros-verified claims and the signatures could be checked by your tooling. The CLWP tool could output a `.json` file with a list of `SignedBslToExecutionChange`s that is agreed on by the community before the fork. This format would also match up with the `POST` method on the beacon API, meaning that clients actually don't need to do _any_ extra work to support CLWP: users could just POST the agreed file to the HTTP endpoint ahead of the fork: <https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Beacon/submitPoolBLSToExecutionChange>

Apologies if you've already come to the same conclusion and I've missed it. Seems like this would be a good way to get lots of clients compatible
